comments.body: Do we also need to check for `startsWith("0")` still?

So actually the parser will not work with those since the syntax changed. I think we should drop `0.` in this PR actually. Let's do a release with `2.12.13`, merge this and that should give enought time for EPFL students to finish their semester and never look at 0.27 version ever gain :sweat_smile:

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +28,32 @@      case "2.12" => Scala212
      case "2.13" => Scala213
      case version if version.startsWith("3.") => Scala3
      case _ => Scala213
    }
